root-item-item_3-text: Poor weight gain or poor growth?
root-item-item_5-text: Hiding food in his/her/your room or “sneaking” food?
root-item-item_6-text: Change in dietary intake (eating significantly more or less than usual)
root-item-item_7-text: Avoiding certain food groups ex: dairy, gluten, grains.
root-item-item_8-text: Eating/feeding less than usual FOR MORE THAN A WEEK?
root-item-item_9-text: Diminished physical activity or sudden increase in physical activity
root-item-item_10-text: Hgb A1c increased by 1% or more (example: from 7 to 8%)?
root-item-item_12-text: Concern with high blood sugars after eating
root-item-item_13-text: Concerns with bowel movements (e.g. too watery or constipated)
root-item-item_14-text: Concerns with stomach pains, nausea, vomiting affecting intakes

root-name: Insulin Pump Roadmap Part A: Readiness Assessment
root-title: Insulin Pump Roadmap Part A: Readiness Assessment
root-item-item_0-text: How often do you review your blood glucose (BG) and make dose adjustments based on the readings?
root-item-item_1-text: Your blood glucose is in target before meals but above target 2-3 hours later. What do you adjust?
root-item-item_2-text: Your blood glucose has been above target for the past 3 mornings when you wake up. What do you do?
root-item-item_3-text: Who gives the insulin in your house? What injection sites do you use?
root-item-item_4-text: Diabetes requires a lot of adjustments in between clinic visits. On a scale of 1–10, where would you rate your confidence with the following? (1 = not at all confident; 10 = very confident)
root-item-item_5-text: How would you treat a blood glucose that was below target (low)?
root-item-item_6-text: What should you do if you have a blood glucose above target (high)?
root-item-item_7-text: How do you manage sick days? When do you check for ketones?
root-item-item_8-text: What should you do if you have ketones? Why is this important?
root-item-item_9-text: How do you plan for activity?
root-item-item_10-text: Which of the following contain more than 5 grams of digestible carbohydrates per serving?
root-item-item_11-text: Dylan wants to have Frosted Mini-Wheats for breakfast. Using the label below, answer the following questions:
root-item-item_12-text: Approximately how many grams of carbohydrates are in the following meal? 2 scrambled eggs 2 sausages 2 slices of 100% whole wheat toast 1 cup of 2% milk 2 Tbsp. blueberry jam
root-item-item_13-text: What is an insulin pump? (Choose all that apply)
root-item-item_14-text: Basal insulin is: (Choose all that apply)
